title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 524.6 - Disciplinary authority
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 524.6 - Disciplinary authority

State Regulations

An applicant who practices law temporarily in this State
pursuant to this Part shall be subject to the New York Rules of Professional

Conduct and to the disciplinary authority of this State in connection with such
temporary practice to the same extent as if the applicant were admitted or
authorized to practice in the State. A grievance committee may report
complaints and evidence of a disciplinary violation against an applicant
practicing temporarily pursuant to this Part to the department of the Appellate

Division of the Supreme Court in which the applicant applied for
authorization. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
524.6

Adopted

New

York State Register July 22, 2020/Volume XLII, Issue 29, eff. 7/22/2020

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
